Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and pink and grey in section, the interior is slightly grooved and spotted with an off-white deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, faded and smudged in parts.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393341) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393341)
